content: बंधुः [बध्नाति मनः स्नेहादिना बंध्-उ] {@--1@} A relation, kinsman, relative in general; यत्र द्रुमा अपि मृगा अपि बंधवो मे <ls>U. 3. 8</ls>: मातृबधुनिवासिनं <ls>R. 12. 12</ls>; <ls>Ś. 6. 22</ls>; <ls>Bg. 6. 9.</ls> {@--2@} Any one connected or associated with another, a brother; प्रवासबंधुः a brothertraveller; धर्मबंधुः a spiritual brother; <ls>Ś. 4. 9.</ls> {@--3@} (In law) A cognate kinsman, one's own kindred or kinsmen generally; (three kinds are enumerated; आत्म° personal, पितृ° paternal, and मातृ° maternal; see these three words). {@--4@} A friend (in general); as in बंधुकृत्य below; <ab>oft.</ab> at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>; मकरदंगंधबंधो <ls>Māl. 1. 38</ls> ‘a friend of, ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) charged with fragrance’ &c.; <ls n="Māl.">9. 13.</ls> {@--5@} A husband; वैदेहिबंधार्हृदयं विदद्रे <ls>R. 14. 33.</ls> {@--6@} A father. {@--7@} A mother. {@--8@} A brother. {@--9@} The tree called बंधुजीव <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--10@} One who belongs to or is connected with any tribe or profession only nominally; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} one who belongs to it, but does not do the duties pertaining thereto (often used by way of contempt); स्वयमेव ब्रह्मबंधुनोद्भिन्नो दुर्गप्रयोगः <ls>M. 4</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> क्षत्रबंधु. {@--11@} Connection, relationship, association in general.
